revision.comment: Moving from [[Category:Privately held companies in the United States]] to [[Category:Privately held companies of the United States]] per [[Wikipedia:Categories for discussion/Log/2018 November 14]] using [[c:Help:Cat-a-lot|Cat-a-lot]]
revision.text:
{{advert|date=September 2018}} {{cleanup|reason=The section headings are advertorial.|date=September 2018}} '''United Talent Agency''' ('''UTA''') is a private talent agency representing artists and other entertainment professionals. The [[Beverly Hills, California]]-based company was established in 1991 and, as of 2017, has approximately 900 employees, around 300 of which are agents. UTA has divisions focused on film, television, digital, books, music, video games, branding and licensing, speaking, marketing, fine arts, news and broadcasting, among others. The agency also operates the non-profit UTA Foundation.{{Infobox company | name = United Talent Agency | logo = UTA Logo.png | type = [[Privately held company|Private]] | foundation = {{Start date and age|1991}} | founders = {{Unbulleted list|Peter Benedek|Jim Berkus|Jeremy Zimmer}} | location_city = 9336 Civic Center Drive [[Beverly Hills, California]] | location_country = [[United States]] | key_people = Jim Berkus, ([[Chairman]])
Jeremy Zimmer ([[Chief executive officer|CEO]])
[[David Kramer (talent agent)|David Kramer]], ([[Co-President]])
[[Jay Sures]], ([[Co-President]])
Peter Benedek, ([[Director (business)|Director]])
| num_employees = {{Unbulleted list|900 (2018)|}} | divisions = {{unbulletedlist| [[UTA Brand Studio]] * Digital * Film * UTA Fine Arts * UTA Foundation * UTA IQ * UTA Marketing * UTA Music * News & Broadcast * Speakers * TV * UTA Ventures }} | homepage = {{URL|unitedtalent.com}} }} == Corporate overview == UTA, established in 1991, is a private company representing talent in a variety of industries, including [[Film industry|film]], [[television]], [[digital media]], publishing, music, and [[Video game industry|video games]], among others.{{Citation|title=The New York Observer|date=2018-07-11|url=https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=The_New_York_Observer&oldid=849860221|work=Wikipedia|language=en|access-date=2018-08-07}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.adweek.com/tvnewser/n-s-bienstock-acquired-by-united-talent-agency/212076|title=N.S. Bienstock Acquired by United Talent Agency|website=www.adweek.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-08-07}} The [[Beverly Hills, California]]-based talent agency is one of the largest in the world, with approximately 300 agents representing actors, directors, producers, recording artists, writers, and other professionals.{{Cite news|url=https://news.artnet.com/art-world/hollywood-agency-announces-plans-to-represent-visual-artists-guess-who-251056|title=Hollywood Agency Plans to Represent Artists – artnet News|date=2015-02-11|work=artnet News|access-date=2018-08-07|language=en-US}} Its services also include [[brand management]], [[Film finance|film financing]] and [[Movie packaging|packaging]], [[License|licensing]], marketing, [[strategic management]], and [[venture capital financing]] for companies.{{Cite news|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/business/7256323/curt-motley-toby-keith-uta-nashville|title=Curt Motley, Toby Keith Join UTA Nashville|work=Billboard|access-date=2018-08-07}} In addition to Beverly Hills, UTA has offices in London, [[Malmö]], Miami, Nashville, and New York.{{Cite news|url=http://www.musicweek.com/live/read/uta-confirms-toronto-office-closure/069341|title=UTA confirms Toronto office closure|access-date=2018-08-07|language=en}} UTA has around 900 employees overall, as of February 2018.{{Cite news|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/business/8098709/uta-lyndsay-harding-chief-financial-officer-first-woman|title=UTA Names Lyndsay Harding Chief Financial Officer|work=Billboard|access-date=2018-08-07}} The company operates as a partnership.{{Cite web|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/envelope/cotown/la-et-ct-caa-agents-united-talent-agency-uta-20150402-story.html|title=CAA agents stage exodus to rival United Talent Agency|last=Villarreal|first=Yvonne|website=latimes.com|access-date=2018-08-07}} Co-founders Jim Berkus and Peter Benedek serve as [[chairman]] and [[Director (business)|director]], respectively.{{Cite news|url=https://www.wmagazine.com/story/united-talent-agency-hollywood-art|title=The Studio System|last=Scott|first=Andrea|work=W Magazine|access-date=2018-08-07|language=en}} Jeremy Zimmer, also a co-founder,{{Cite news|url=http://www.nytimes.com/2013/12/15/business/jeremy-zimmer-of-united-talent-agency-on-accepting-ideas.html|title=Jeremy Zimmer of United Talent Agency, on Accepting Ideas|last=Bryant|first=Adam|access-date=2018-08-07|language=en}} serves as [[chief executive officer]] (CEO). [[David Kramer (talent agent)|David Kramer]] and [[Jay Sures]] serve as co-[[President (corporate title)|presidents]]. These executives serve on the [[board of director]]s along with Tracey Jacobs, Blair Kohan,{{Cite news|url=http://variety.com/2018/biz/news/uta-agent-blair-kohan-board-of-directors-1202659962/|title=UTA Partner Blair Kohan Joins Agency's Board of Directors|last=Kroll|first=Justin|date=2018-01-10|work=Variety|access-date=2018-08-07|language=en-US}} and Matt Rice. == History == === Founding and early history === United Talent Agency was established in 1991 through the merger of the Bauer-Benedek Agency and Leading Artists Agency.{{cite web|url=http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/money_co/2011/11/united-talent-agency-leases-former-hilton-hotels-headquarters.html/|title=United Talent Agency leases former Hilton Hotels headquarters|date=15 November 2011|publisher=}} Jim Berkus, Jeremy Zimmer,{{Cite news|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/powerhouse-agents-impressive-art-collection-753195|title=This Powerhouse Agent's Impressive Art Collection Includes a Massive Portrait of Tilda Swinton|work=The Hollywood Reporter|access-date=2018-08-07|language=en}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/business/8093780/united-talent-agency-blair-kohan-agent-board-of-directors|title=UTA Names Agent Blair Kohan to Board of Directors|work=Billboard|access-date=2018-08-07}} and Peter Benedek are UTA's co-founders.{{Cite web|url=https://www.ft.com/content/d3ea7bca-4d63-11e4-8f75-00144feab7de|title=Subscribe to read|website=Financial Times|language=en-GB|access-date=2018-08-07}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2018/01/08/can-hollywood-change-its-ways|title=Can Hollywood Change Its Ways?|work=The New Yorker|access-date=2018-08-07|language=en-US}} Berkus and Zimmer first discussed forming a new company during a rafting trip the two took, when Berkus led Leading Artists and Zimmer was a partner at Bauer/Benedek.{{Cite news|url=http://variety.com/exec/jeremy-zimmer/|title=Jeremy Zimmer|last=Piper-Shimizu|first=Stephane|date=2017-10-04|work=Variety|access-date=2018-08-07|language=en-US}} UTA had 10 partners and 40 agents by mid 1994.{{Cite news|url=http://articles.latimes.com/1994-07-26/business/fi-19974_1_united-talent-agency|title=Company Town : United Talent Agency's Star Ascends|last=CITRON|first=ALAN|date=1994-07-26|work=Los Angeles Times|access-date=2018-08-07|language=en-US|issn=0458-3035}} The company began compiling a weekly list of mostly entry-level employment opportunities across the entertainment industry, which was described by the ''[[Los Angeles Times]]'' in 2001 as "among the most coveted documents in wannabe Hollywood".{{Cite news|url=http://articles.latimes.com/2001/apr/22/news/cl-54002|title=The List—Where Hollywood Dreams Begin|last=O'NEILL|first=ANN|date=2001-04-22|work=Los Angeles Times|access-date=2018-08-07|language=en-US|issn=0458-3035}}{{Cite news|url=https://variety.com/2005/biz/news/are-you-on-the-list-1117920155/|title=Are you on the list?|last=Boyd|first=Betsy|date=2005-03-28|work=Variety|access-date=2018-08-07|language=en-US}} In mid 1996, the company had expanded to 45 agents and was described in the media as one of Hollywood's "big four" agencies, and reported that the company had 45 agents.{{Cite news|title="Hollywood; The Big Four"|last=Dutka|first=Elaine|date=June 23, 1996|work=Los Angeles Times|access-date=}} By the early 2000s, the agency had become known for its roster of comedians including [[Jim Carrey]], [[Dave Chappelle]], [[Will Ferrell]], and [[Ben Stiller]], along with writers for popular comedy television programs.{{Cite web|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/envelope/cotown/la-et-ct-uta-comedy-20150403-story.html|title=The power of comedy is subplot in agency war|last=James|first=Yvonne Villarreal, Meg|website=latimes.com|access-date=2018-08-07}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/envelope/cotown/la-et-ct-uta-comedy-20150403-story.html|title=The power of comedy is subplot in agency war|last=James|first=Yvonne Villarreal, Meg|website=latimes.com|access-date=2018-08-07}} UTA was also known for its television talent, representing clients such as [[David Chase]] and [[Dick Wolf]]. In 2006, the ''Los Angeles Times'' described UTA as a "tastemaker" agency, noting clients such as [[Don Cheadle]], [[Johnny Depp]], and [[M. Night Shyamalan]].{{Cite news|title=Talent Firms May Merge to Keep Pace; Agencies are selling to fewer, bigger buyers. Personal ties may set matches in motion|last=Hoffman|first=Claire|date=March 13, 2006|work=Los Angeles Times|access-date=}} The agency established "UTA U" in 2008 to provide skills training to interns by partners and other executives. The program also includes a community service component.{{Cite news|url=http://deadline.com/2009/03/update-caa-u-uta-u-too-8854/|title=CAA U? UTA U, Too|last=Finke|first=Nikki|date=2009-03-20|work=Deadline|access-date=2018-08-07|language=en-US}} UTA was inducted into ''[[Vanity Fair (magazine)|Vanity Fair]]'''s "New Establishment Hall of Fame" in 2010.{{Cite news|url=https://www.vanityfair.com/news/2015/09/new-establishment-2015-hall-of-fame|title=The 2015 New Establishment Hall of Fame|last=Fair|first=Vanity|work=The Hive|access-date=2018-08-07|language=en}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.vanityfair.com/news/2017/10/the-new-establishment-hall-of-fame|title=The 2017 New Establishment Hall of Fame|last=Fair|first=Vanity|work=The Hive|access-date=2018-08-07|language=en}} === Recent history === In 2011, UTA relocated its headquarters to a Civic Center Drive complex, which was renamed UTA Plaza.{{Cite news|url=http://deadline.com/2011/11/uta-moving-to-new-beverly-hills-location-195540/|title=UTA Moving To New Beverly Hills Location: 9336–9346 Civic Center Complex Named UTA Plaza|last=Finke|first=Nikki|date=2011-11-16|work=Deadline|access-date=2018-08-07|language=en-US}} The company acquired [[N.S. Bienstock]], one of the largest agencies for television news talent in the United States, in January 2014.{{Cite news|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/uta-acquires-new-york-tv-673119|title=UTA Acquires New York TV News Power Agency N.S. Bienstock|work=The Hollywood Reporter|access-date=2018-08-07|language=en}} N.S. Bienstock represented more than 600 television news anchors, reporters, and producers, including: [[Glenn Beck]], [[Anderson Cooper]], [[Megyn Kelly]], [[Steve Kroft]], [[Lara Logan]], [[David Muir]], [[Norah O'Donnell]], [[Bill O'Reilly (political commentator)|Bill O'Reilly]], [[Robin Roberts (newscaster)|Robin Roberts]], [[Bob Schieffer]], and [[Bob Simon]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/envelope/cotown/la-et-ct-uta-deal-20150820-story.html|title=UTA buys the Agency Group|last=Verrier|first=Richard|website=latimes.com|access-date=2018-08-07}} Richard Leibner and Carole Cooper continued to serve in their roles as co-presidents of N.S. Bienstock.{{Cite web|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/envelope/cotown/la-et-ct-united-talent-agency-acquires-news-agency-ns-bienstock-20140122-story.html|title=United Talent Agency acquires TV news agency N.S. Bienstock|last=Miller|first=By Daniel|website=latimes.com|access-date=2018-08-07}} The merger made UTA the largest company representing television news talent. In 2017, UTA did not renew O'Reilly's contract due to allegations of [[sexual harassment]].{{Cite news|url=http://money.cnn.com/2017/10/26/media/bill-oreilly-dropped-williams-morris-endeavor/index.html|title=Bill O'Reilly dropped by another talent agency|last=Kludt|first=Tom|work=CNNMoney|access-date=2018-08-07}}{{Cite news|url=http://thehill.com/media/356911-oreilly-dropped-by-talent-agency-after-report-of-sexual-harassment-settlement-report|title=O'Reilly dropped by talent agency after sexual harassment settlement scandal: report|last=Thomsen|first=Jacqueline|date=2017-10-24|work=TheHill|access-date=2018-08-07|language=en}} The venture was rebranded UTA News & Broadcast in 2017.{{Cite news|url=http://variety.com/2017/tv/news/peter-goldberg-head-ute-news-broadcasting-n-s-bienstock-1202558090/|title=Peter Goldberg Named Head of UTA News and Broadcasting|last=Littleton|first=Cynthia|date=2017-09-14|work=Variety|access-date=2018-08-07|language=en-US}} The agency created a new publishing imprint called Keywords Press in May 2014, to publish books by internet entertainers. UTA partnered with [[Atria Publishing Group]], a division of [[Simon & Schuster]], to create the imprint. Keywords announced deals with [[Shane Dawson]], [[Connor Franta]], and [[Joey Graceffa]].{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2014/05/22/business/media/media-companies-join-to-extend-the-brands-of-youtube-stars.html|title=Media Companies Join to Extend the Brands of YouTube Stars|access-date=2018-08-07|language=en}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.adweek.com/galleycat/atria-united-talent-launch-keywords-press/87098|title=Atria & United Talent Launch Keywords Press|website=www.adweek.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-08-07}} In 2015, UTA hired a dozen agents from [[Creative Artists Agency]] in what was widely characterized in the media as a "midnight raid".{{Cite news|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/features/a-phone-call-betrayal-how-787120|title=A Phone Call, "Betrayal" and How the "Midnight Raid" at CAA Happened|work=The Hollywood Reporter|access-date=2018-08-07|language=en}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/08/21/business/media/jeffrey-ubben-buys-minority-stake-in-united-talent-agency.html|title=Jeffrey Ubben Buys Minority Stake in United Talent Agency|access-date=2018-08-07|language=en}} Creative Artists Agency filed a lawsuit in response.{{Cite web|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/envelope/cotown/la-et-ct-talent-agencies-private-equity-20150710-story.html|title=Wall Street investors to Hollywood talent agencies: 'Show us the money'|last=Rottenberg|first=Josh|website=latimes.com|access-date=2018-08-07}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/theft-of-a-list-clients-sparks-hollywood-talent-agency-battle-10154925.html|title='Theft' of A-list clients sparks Hollywood talent agency battle|work=The Independent|access-date=2018-08-07|language=en-GB}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/04/03/business/media/in-hollywood-a-list-talent-agencies-battle-over-departure-of-agents.html|title=In Hollywood, A-List Talent Agencies Battle Over Departure of Agents|access-date=2018-08-07|language=en}} Also in that year, the company took a minority investment from [[Jeffrey W. Ubben]], founder and CEO of [[ValueAct Capital]], who became a non-voting UTA board member. ValueAct also was invested in [[21st Century Fox]], [[Adobe Systems]], [[CBRE Group|CB Richard Ellis]], and [[Microsoft]] at the time. UTA acquired The Agency Group (TAG), the world's largest [[independent music]] agency, in August 2015. TAG had approximately 95 agents working in cities including London, Los Angeles, and New York, and brought around 2,000 artists into UTA's client portfolio,{{Cite news|url=|title=DJ Khaled Signs With United Talent Agency: Exclusive"|last=Gensler|first=Andy|date=January 20, 2016|work=Billboard|access-date=}}{{Cite news|url=|title=Muse Signs With United Talent Agency for Worldwide Representation: Exclusive|last=|first=|date=April 28, 2016|work=Billboard|access-date=}} including [[Muse (band)|Muse]], [[Paramore]] and [[The Black Keys]]. UTA expanded its New York City offices in 2016.{{Cite news|url=|title=Hollywood powerhouse UTA expands footprint in NYC|last=Weiss|first=Lois|date=January 13, 2016|work=New York Post|access-date=}}{{Cite news|url=https://therealdeal.com/2016/01/13/talent-agency-signs-for-triplex-hq-at-vornados-888-seventh/|title=Talent agency signs for triplex HQ at Vornado's 888 Seventh|date=2016-01-13|work=The Real Deal New York|access-date=2018-08-07|language=en-US}} In early 2017, UTA held several events relating to political and social movements. In lieu of its annual [[Academy Awards]] party, UTA organized a "United Voices" rally outside the company's Beverly Hills headquarters two days before the [[89th Academy Awards]], in response to President [[Donald Trump]]'s signing of [[Executive Order 13769]], commonly referred to as the "Muslim travel ban".{{Cite news|url=http://www.newsweek.com/uta-cancels-oscar-party-will-protest-trumps-immigration-ban-instead-554776|title=Major talent agency cancels Oscar party, will protest Trump's immigration ban instead|date=2017-02-09|work=Newsweek|access-date=2018-08-07|language=en}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2017/feb/8/united-talent-agency-cancels-oscar-party-anti-trum/|title=United Talent Agency cancels Oscar party as an anti-Trump protest: Report|last=http://www.washingtontimes.com|first=The Washington Times|work=The Washington Times|access-date=2018-08-07|language=en-US}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/tv/uta-protests-trump-muslim-ban-cancels-oscar-party-rally-article-1.2967526|title=United Talent Agency protests Trump Muslim ban by canceling Oscar party and donating $250,000 to ACLU   – NY Daily News|last=Kaplan|first=Don|work=nydailynews.com|access-date=2018-08-07|language=en-US}} As many as 2,000 demonstrators attended in support of refugee relief and [[freedom of speech]], including [[Michael J. Fox]], [[Gavin Newsom]], [[Bill Nye]], [[Wilmer Valderrama]], and [[Kristen Wiig]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/movies/la-et-mn-oscars-2017-uta-immigration-rally-20170224-story.html|title=Jodie Foster, other celebs urge action at UTA Oscars rally: 'This is our time to resist'|last=Yamato|first=Jen|website=latimes.com|access-date=2018-08-07}}{{Cite news|url=|title=Hollywood Talent Agency Ditches Usual Oscar Party in Favor of Anti-Trump Rally|last=Strachan|first=Maxwell|date=February 25, 2017|work=Huffington Post|access-date=}}{{Cite news|url=|title=United Talent Agency skips Oscar bash, throws rally instead|last=|first=|date=February 25, 2017|work=USA Today|access-date=}}{{Cite news|url=|title=A Pre-Oscar Protest in Beverly Hills|last=Marikar|first=Sheila|date=March 13, 2017|work=The New Yorker|access-date=}} UTA also contributed $250,000, plus $70,000 collected via [[crowdfunding]], to the [[American Civil Liberties Union]] and the [[International Rescue Committee]]. The company hosted events for female employees in Los Angeles, New York, and Toronto as part of the [[Day Without a Woman]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/la-et-entertainment-news-updates-march-uta-highlights-a-day-without-a-woman-1488911823-htmlstory.html|title=United Talent Agency highlights 'A Day Without a Woman' with employee events|last=Hill|first=Libby|website=latimes.com|access-date=2018-08-07}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/la-et-entertainment-news-updates-march-hollywood-celebrates-international-1488993270-htmlstory.html|title=From social media blackouts to celeb tweets, Hollywood salutes International Women's Day|last=Hill|first=Libby|website=latimes.com|access-date=2018-08-07}} In March 2017, UTA acquired an [[Equity (finance)|equity stake]] in the [[investment banking]] firm AGM Partners to give the agency and its clients guidance on investments in the media and entertainment sector.{{Cite web|url=http://labusinessjournal.com/news/2017/sep/12/united-talent-agency-acquires-greater-talent-netwo/|title=United Talent Agency Acquires Greater Talent Network {{!}} Los Angeles Business Journal|website=labusinessjournal.com|access-date=2018-08-07}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.marketwatch.com/story/uta-follows-hollywood-talent-agency-trend-and-takes-stake-in-an-investment-bank-2017-03-10|title=UTA follows Hollywood talent agency trend and takes stake in an investment bank|last=Schwartzel|first=Erich|work=MarketWatch|access-date=2018-08-07|language=en-US}} UTA acquired [[Greater Talent Network]] (GTN), which focuses on public speaking engagements, in September 2017.{{Cite web|url=http://www.latimes.com/business/hollywood/la-fi-ct-uta-gtn-acquisition-20170912-story.html|title=L.A.-based United Talent Agency acquires speakers' booking group GTN|last=Battaglio|first=Stephen|website=latimes.com|access-date=2018-08-07}} Don Epstein, GTN's founder and CEO who represented clients like [[Louis Freeh]], [[Michael Lewis]], [[Alex Rodriguez]], [[Mark Ruffalo]], and [[Lesley Stahl]], was named a partner at UTA. GTN continued to operate from its offices in Florida and New York City. The ''[[New York Observer]]'' named UTA one of "Hollywood's 7 Most Powerful Talent Agencies" in November 2017. In December, the agency also hosted [[Anita Hill]] at its offices during the early days of the [[Me Too movement]],{{Cite news|url=https://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2017/12/anita-hill-schools-hollywood-sexual-harassment|title=Anita Hill Schools Hollywood on Sexual Harassment|last=Sperling|first=Nicole|work=HWD|access-date=2018-08-07|language=en}} and provided support to the industry's Commission on Sexual Harassment and Advancing Equality in the Workplace, which Hill went on to lead.{{Cite news|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/top-hollywood-execs-unveil-anti-sexual-harassment-commission-chaired-by-anita-hill-1068646|title=Top Hollywood Execs Unveil Anti-Sexual Harassment Commission Chaired by Anita Hill|work=The Hollywood Reporter|access-date=2018-08-07|language=en}} UTA became a founding donor of [[Time's Up (movement)|Time's Up]] in early 2018, committing $1 million to the organization against [[sexual harassment]] in the workplace in response to the [[Weinstein effect]] and Me Too movement.{{Cite news|url=http://deadline.com/2018/01/times-up-empowerment-group-starts-legal-defense-fund-for-sex-harassment-cases-1202234089/|title=Time's Up Empowerment Group Starts Legal Defense Fund For Sex Harassments|last=Haring|first=Bruce|date=2018-01-01|work=Deadline|access-date=2018-08-07|language=en-US}}{{Cite news|url=|title=UTA Partner Blair Kohan Named To Agency's Board of Directors|last=Hipes|first=Patrick|date=January 10, 2018|work=Deadline Hollywood|access-date=}} UTA acquired Circle Talent Agency, which focuses on [[Dance music|dance]] and electronic music, in April 2018.{{Cite news|url=|title="UTA Acquires Dance-Music-Centric Circle Talent Agency".|last=|first=|date=April 17, 2018|work=Variety|access-date=}} ==Service areas== === Branding and marketing === {{See also|UTA Brand Studio}} UTA Brand Studio provides brand strategy consulting services for corporate brands as well as UTA's traditional talent.{{Cite news|url=http://www.nytimes.com/2012/06/04/business/media/united-talent-agency-adds-brand-strategy-unit.html|title=United Talent Agency Adds Brand Strategy Unit|last=Elliott|first=Stuart|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en}} UTA Marketing advises clients including [[Amazon (company)|Amazon]], [[Delta Air Lines]], [[General Motors]], [[LinkedIn]], and [[Lyft]]. === Digital === UTA's digital department focuses on entertainment and programming on emerging platforms, digital talent, event management, and development of new ventures.{{Cite news|url=http://variety.com/2007/scene/markets-festivals/uta-moses-taking-brand-stand-1117971708/|title=UTA, Moses taking brand stand|last=Graser|first=Marc|date=2007-09-10|work=Variety|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en-US}}{{Cite news|url=https://deadline.com/2018/06/united-talent-agency-promotes-brent-weinstein-chief-innovation-officer-1202410574/|title=UTA Promotes Brent Weinstein To Chief Innovation Officer|last=Chmielewski|first=Dawn C.|date=2018-06-14|work=Deadline|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en-US}} Clients and projects include [[Rhett and Link]], [[Hannah Hart]],{{Cite news|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/rep-sheet-roundup-uta-launches-podcast-network-ramble-cadence13-1122851|title=Rep Sheet Roundup: UTA Launches Podcast Network Ramble With Cadence13|work=The Hollywood Reporter|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en}} [[Marc Smerling]],{{Cite news|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/fx-adapting-crimetown-podcast-jinx-creators-1058666|title=FX Adapting 'Crimetown' Podcast From 'The Jinx' Creators|work=The Hollywood Reporter|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en}} [[The Lonely Island]], and [[Smosh]],{{Cite news|url=http://www.laweekly.com/news/hollywood-schmoozer-meets-internet-geek-2150921|title=Hollywood Schmoozer Meets Internet Geek|last=Alimurung|first=Gendy|date=2007-11-14|work=L.A. Weekly|access-date=2018-08-06}} as well as the podcasts and networks [[Wondery]],{{Cite news|url=https://deadline.com/2018/06/ramble-podcast-network-uta-cadence13-launch-1202414617/|title=UTA And Cadence13 Launch Ramble Podcast Network For Digital Stars|last=Hipes|first=Patrick|date=2018-06-20|work=Deadline|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en-US}} ''[[My Favorite murder]]'',{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/05/19/style/my-favorite-murder-podcast-murderinos.html|title=Grisly Murders and Serial Killers? Ooh, Tell Me More|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en}} ''[[S-Town]]'',{{Cite news|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/hot-podcasts-demand-tv-producers-1080267|title=Hot Podcasts in Demand for TV Producers|work=The Hollywood Reporter|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en}} and ''[[Up and Vanished]]''.{{Cite web|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/the-switch/wp/2017/12/09/how-two-men-turned-a-google-search-and-100-into-a-hit-podcast-and-a-tv-deal/|title=How two men turned a Google search and $100 into a hit podcast and a TV deal|last=https://www.facebook.com/htsuka|website=Washington Post|language=en|access-date=2018-08-06}} Its ventures division made early investments in [[Crowdrise]],{{Cite news|url=https://techcrunch.com/2014/04/21/fred-wilson-leads-23m-funding-for-crowdrise-a-charity-water-for-everyone/|title=Fred Wilson Leads $23M Funding in CrowdRise, A ‘Charity Water’ For Everyone|work=TechCrunch|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en-US}} [[Lyft]],{{Cite news|url=http://variety.com/2017/digital/news/lyft-alphabet-1-billion-funding-round-1202594140/|title=Lyft Lands $1 Billion Funding Round Led by Alphabet, Google's Parent|last=Spangler|first=Todd|date=2017-10-19|work=Variety|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en-US}} and [[AwesomenessTV]],{{Cite news|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/hollywoods-hot-new-job-startup-investment-specialist-943094|title=Hollywood's Hot New Job: Startup Investment Specialist|work=The Hollywood Reporter|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en}} incubating the latter through its ultimate sale to [[DreamWorks Animation]].{{Cite news|url=http://variety.com/2013/biz/news/inside-the-deal-how-dreamworks-animation-snagged-awesomenesstv-1200442597/|title=Inside the Deal: How DreamWorks Animation Snagged AwesomenessTV|last=Graser|first=Marc|date=2013-05-03|work=Variety|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en-US}} The digital division also represents technology trade shows, including the [[Consumer Electronics Show]] and [[VidCon]].{{Cite news|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/how-ces-became-a-see-851663|title=How CES Became a "Must-See" Event for Hollywood|work=The Hollywood Reporter|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/envelope/cotown/la-et-ct-vidcon-expansion-20160613-snap-story.html|title=VidCon, the annual video star convention, has gotten so big it's expanding globally|last=Pierson|first=Yvonne Villarreal and David|website=latimes.com|access-date=2018-08-06}} UTA IQ specializes in third-party [[data analysis]] and [[predictive analytics]].{{Cite news|url=http://variety.com/2017/biz/news/joseph-kessler-uta-iq-1202631179/|title=Joseph Kessler Named Global Head of New UTA Data Division|last=Fernandez|first=Matt|date=2017-12-05|work=Variety|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en-US}} UTA and [[Rentrak]] worked together to develop the [[social data analysis]] product called PreAct, which helps predict [[box office]] success based on social media engagement.{{Cite news|url=http://variety.com/2015/digital/news/how-hollywood-is-using-social-data-to-better-reach-audiences-or-not-1201394890/|title=How Hollywood Is Using Social Data to Better Reach Audiences – Or Not|last=Spangler|first=Todd|date=2015-01-07|work=Variety|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en-US}} === Film and television === UTA represents actors, directors, writers, producers, and other professionals across scripted and unscripted film and television projects.{{Cite news|url=http://observer.com/2017/11/hollywood-talent-agencies-wme-uta-apa-icm-info-details/|title=Content Kings: Hollywood’s 7 Most Powerful Talent Agencies|date=2017-11-07|work=Observer|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en-US}} Clients include [[Judd Apatow]], the [[Coen brothers]], [[Angelina Jolie]], [[Frances McDormand]], [[Kumail Nanjiani]],{{Cite news|url=https://variety.com/2017/film/features/10-actors-to-watch-kumail-nanjiani-1202578273/|title=10 Actors to Watch: Kumail Nanjiani Builds Buzz for ‘The Big Sick’|last=Dore|first=Shalini|date=2017-10-04|work=Variety|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en-US}} [[Seth Rogen]], and [[Amy Schumer]].{{Cite news|url=https://deadline.com/2018/06/united-talent-agency-forty-percent-equity-stake-moelis-and-company-1202416789/|title=Expansion-Hungry UTA Taps Moelis & Company To Explore 40% Equity Sale|last=Jr|first=Mike Fleming|date=2018-06-25|work=Deadline|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en-US}} The agency's independent film group also conducts film finance, packaging,{{Cite news|url=http://variety.com/2018/tv/features/talent-agents-production-conflicts-of-interest-1202695460/|title=Talent Agencies Face Conflicts of Interest as Parent Companies Storm into Production Arena|last=Littleton|first=Cynthia|date=2018-02-13|work=Variety|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en-US}} production, and sales work.{{Cite news|url=http://variety.com/2015/biz/news/uta-promotes-eight-agents-to-partner-1201449796/|title=UTA Promotes Eight Agents to Partner|last=Kroll|first=Justin|date=2015-03-10|work=Variety|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en-US}}{{Cite news|url=http://deadline.com/2017/05/agents-caa-wme-uta-disruptors-interviews-news-1202094263/|title=How Agencies Became So Vital to the Indie Film Ecosystem – Deadline Disruptors|last=Jr|first=Mike Fleming|date=2017-05-18|work=Deadline|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en-US}} === Fine arts === UTA's [[fine art]] division manages the careers of [[Contemporary art|contemporary]] and [[Visual arts|visual artists]], such as [[Joe Bradley (artist)|Joe Bradley]], [[Larry Clark]],{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/09/01/arts/design/united-talent-agency-artist-space-los-angeles.html|title=A Hollywood Agency Opens an Art Space, but It Won't ‘Function Like a Gallery’|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/7bm8mb/is-the-future-of-fine-art-in-hollywoods-hands-josh-roth-uta|title=Is the Future of Fine Art in Hollywood's Hands?|date=2016-09-18|work=Vice|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en-us}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/arts/la-et-cm-larry-clark-uta-20160916-snap-story.html|title=Larry Clark turns life into art for photo exhibit at new United Talent Agency gallery|last=Gelt|first=Jessica|website=latimes.com|access-date=2018-08-06}} [[Kurt Cobain]],{{Cite news|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/unreleased-kurt-cobain-paintings-displayed-seattle-article-1.3384296|title=Unreleased Kurt Cobain paintings to be displayed at Seattle Art Fair  – NY Daily News|last=Hitt|first=Caitlyn|work=nydailynews.com|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en-US}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.papermag.com/kurt-cobains-never-before-seen-paintings-give-you-a-glimpse-into-his-mind-2469135587.html|title=Kurt Cobain's Never-Before-Seen Paintings Give You a Glimpse into His Mind|date=2017-08-04|work=PAPER|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en}} [[Dennis Hopper]], [[Mike Kelley (artist)|Mike Kelley]], [[Nate Lowman]], and [[Elizabeth Peyton]],{{Cite web|url=http://www.laweekly.com/slideshow/this-never-before-seen-art-by-kurt-cobain-goes-on-display-today-8498329|title=This Never-Before-Seen Art by Kurt Cobain Goes on Display Today|website=L.A. Weekly|access-date=2018-08-06}} Ai Weiwei,{{Cite news|url=http://observer.com/2016/06/ai-weiwei-joins-united-talent-agency-david-nahmad-denies-his-modigliani-is-nazi-loot/|title=Ai Weiwei Joins United Talent Agency, David Nahmad Denies His Modigliani Is Nazi Loot|date=2016-06-13|work=Observer|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en-US}} and [[Pae White]].{{Cite news|url=http://www.wsj.com/articles/hollywood-talent-agencys-new-division-to-manage-visual-artists-careers-1423616988|title=Hollywood Agency to Manage Careers of Visual Artists|last=Crow|first=Kelly|date=2015-02-11|work=Wall Street Journal|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en-US|issn=0099-9660}} In 2016, UTA opened a 4,500-square-foot (420 m2) venue, called UTA Artist Space, in Los Angeles' [[Boyle Heights, Los Angeles|Boyle Heights]] neighborhood.{{Cite news|url=https://news.artnet.com/market/united-talent-agency-exhibition-629750|title=United Talent to Open Los Angeles Exhibition Venue {{!}} artnet News|date=2016-08-31|work=artnet News|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en-US}}{{Cite news|url=http://variety.com/2016/biz/news/uta-artist-space-larry-clark-1201849406/|title=UTA Launches Downtown L.A. Artist Space With Larry Clark Show|last=Roshanian|first=Arya|date=2016-08-31|work=Variety|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en-US}} It also partnered with [[Swire Properties]] to conduct a week-long program at [[Art Basel]] Hong Kong.{{Cite news|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/uta-fine-arts-brings-larry-877896|title=UTA Fine Arts Brings Larry Bell to Art Basel Hong Kong|work=The Hollywood Reporter|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en}}{{Cite news|url=https://news.artnet.com/art-world/the-week-in-art-march-asia-arts-awards-solange-456116|title=The Week in Art: Asia Arts Awards and Solange – artnet News|date=2016-03-25|work=artnet News|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en-US}}{{Cite news|url=https://news.artnet.com/art-world/hong-kong-diary-adrian-chen-josh-roth-uli-sigg-galleries-galleries-galleries-457808|title=Diary From Art Basel Hong Kong 2016 – artnet News|date=2016-03-27|work=artnet News|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en-US}} The artist space relocated to Beverly Hills in mid 2018. [[Ai Weiwei]] collaborated on the renovation of the new venue.{{Cite news|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/uta-fine-arts-debuts-beverly-hills-artist-space-1125841|title=UTA Fine Arts Debuts Beverly Hills Artist Space|work=The Hollywood Reporter|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.barrons.com/articles/uta-opens-new-ai-weiwei-designed-art-gallery-1531776780|title=UTA Opens New Ai Weiwei-Designed Art Gallery|last=Block|first=Fang|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en-US}} === Music === The company's music division has agents representing and booking talent such as [[Guns N' Roses]], [[Post Malone]], [[Lenny Kravitz]], [[Marshmello]], [[Mariah Carey]], [[Toby Keith]] and [[DJ Khaled]].{{Cite news|url=https://deadline.com/2018/04/circle-talent-agency-acquired-uta-dance-music-roster-1202366412/|title=UTA Goes EDM, Acquires Circle Talent Agency|last=Hipes|first=Patrick|date=2018-04-17|work=Deadline|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en-US}} Artists span multiple genres, including [[Classical music|classical]], [[Country music|country]],{{Cite news|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/business/7256323/curt-motley-toby-keith-uta-nashville|title=Curt Motley, Toby Keith Join UTA Nashville|work=Billboard|access-date=2018-08-06}} [[Electronic music|electronic]], [[Hip hop music|hip hop]], independent, [[jazz]], [[Pop music|pop]], [[reggae]], and [[Rock music|rock]].{{Cite news|url=http://variety.com/2018/biz/news/uta-united-talent-agency-acquires-dance-music-circle-talent-agency-1202756005/|title=UTA Acquires Dance-Music-Centric Circle Talent Agency|last=Staff|first=Variety|date=2018-04-17|work=Variety|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en-US}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/envelope/cotown/la-et-ct-uta-deal-20150820-story.html|title=UTA buys the Agency Group|last=Verrier|first=Richard|website=latimes.com|access-date=2018-08-06}} === News and broadcast === UTA's News & Broadcast division represents television news professionals in local and national markets,{{Cite web|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/envelope/cotown/la-et-ct-united-talent-agency-acquires-news-agency-ns-bienstock-20140122-story.html|title=United Talent Agency acquires TV news agency N.S. Bienstock|last=Miller|first=By Daniel|website=latimes.com|access-date=2018-08-06}}{{Cite news|url=http://variety.com/2014/tv/news/uta-makes-big-move-into-tv-news-with-acquisition-of-n-s-bienstock-agency-1201066579/|title=UTA Makes Big Move into TV News With Acquisition of N.S. Bienstock Agency|last=Littleton|first=Cynthia|date=2014-01-22|work=Variety|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en-US}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/cbs-news-exec-joins-uta-857623|title=CBS News Exec Joins UTA's Bienstock as Agent|work=The Hollywood Reporter|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en}} including [[Anderson Cooper]], [[Chuck Todd]], [[Jake Tapper]], [[Don Lemon]], [[Dana Bash]], [[Jodi Kantor]] and [[Norah O'Donnell]].{{Cite news|url=https://deadline.com/2018/06/united-talent-agency-forty-percent-equity-stake-moelis-and-company-1202416789/|title=Expansion-Hungry UTA Taps Moelis & Company To Explore 40% Equity Sale|last=Jr|first=Mike Fleming|date=2018-06-25|work=Deadline|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en-US}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.mediaite.com/online/uta-and-mediaite-to-co-host-white-house-correspondents-dinner-celebration-of-americas-journalists/|title=UTA and Mediaite to Co-Host White House Correspondent's Dinner Celebration of America's Journalists|website=www.mediaite.com|language=en|access-date=2018-08-06}} === Speakers === UTA's speakers division books public speaking events in the business, entertainment, media, politics, and sports fields.{{Cite web|url=http://labusinessjournal.com/news/2017/sep/12/united-talent-agency-acquires-greater-talent-netwo/|title=United Talent Agency Acquires Greater Talent Network {{!}} Los Angeles Business Journal|website=labusinessjournal.com|access-date=2018-08-06}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.latimes.com/business/hollywood/la-fi-ct-uta-gtn-acquisition-20170912-story.html|title=L.A.-based United Talent Agency acquires speakers' booking group GTN|last=Battaglio|first=Stephen|website=latimes.com|access-date=2018-08-06}} Clients include [[Billy Beane]], [[Preet Bharara]], [[Mark Burnett]], [[Alex Rodriguez]] and [[George Takei]].{{Cite news|url=https://deadline.com/2017/09/uta-acquires-greater-talent-network-elite-speakers-bureau-new-york-1202167680/|title=UTA Acquires New York-Based Greater Talent Network, Elite Speakers Bureau|last=Busch|first=Anita|date=2017-09-12|work=Deadline|access-date=2018-08-06|language=en-US}} == UTA Foundation == The agency operates a non-profit organization called UTA Foundation. The foundation's annual week-long Project Impact has worked with dozens of organizations in cities around the world and encourages employees to offer community service.{{Cite news|url=http://variety.com/2016/scene/news/uta-jeremy-zimmer-shut-down-project-impact-1201798108/|title=UTA Celebrates Week of Community Service Around Globe|last=McClendon|first=Lamarco|date=2016-06-18|work=Variety|access-date=2018-08-07|language=en-US}} The foundation also launched the Live Inspired program in 2016, which allows five UTA employees each year an opportunity to pursue their personal or philanthropic goals during a one-week paid sabbatical.{{Cite news|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/my-six-days-silence-a-hollywood-agent-puts-down-his-phone-once-1073218|title=My Six Days of Silence: A Hollywood Agent Puts Down His Phone (for Once)|work=The Hollywood Reporter|access-date=2018-08-07|language=en}} ==Clients== ===Actors and performers=== {{div col|colwidth=20em}} *[[21 Savage]] *[[Alicia Vikander]] *[[Angelina Jolie]] *[[Anthony Hopkins]] *[[Amanda Oleander]] *[[Ben Foster]] *[[Benedict Cumberbatch]] *[[Bryan Cranston]] *[[Channing Tatum]] *[[Chris Pratt]] *[[Claudia Kim]] *[[Daniel Dae Kim]] *[[Daniel Radcliffe]] *[[Darci Lynne Farmer]] *[[Davisson Brothers Band]] *[[Diane Kruger]] *[[Diane Lane]] *[[DJ Khaled]] *[[Don Cheadle]] *[[Edward Norton]] *[[Elizabeth Banks]] *[[Emma Chamberlain]] https://www.tubefilter.com/2018/07/23/uta-signs-emma-chamberlain/ *[[Ewan McGregor]] *[[Fala Chen]] *[[Freddie Highmore]] *[[Franco Escamilla]] *[[Guns 'N Roses]] *[[Gwyneth Paltrow]] *[[Ha Ji-won]] *[[Harrison Ford]] *[[Ice Cube]] *[[January Jones]] *[[James Franco]] *[[James McAvoy]] *[[Jeremy Piven]] *[[Jessica Jung]] *[[Karl Urban]] *[[Keenen Ivory Wayans]] *[[Kevin Hart]] *[[Kirsten Dunst]] *[[Lauren Jauregui]] *[[Lee Byung Hun]] *[[Mariah Carey]] *[[Mark Ruffalo]] *[[Martin Freeman]] *[[Martin Lawrence]] *[[Mastodon (band)|Mastodon]] *[[Michael Dión]] *[[Michael Douglas]] *[[Misha Collins]] *[[Mishu Hilmy]] *[[Oscar Isaac]] *[[Owen Wilson]] *[[Patrick Dempsey]] *[[Paul Giamatti]] *[[Paul Rudd]] *[[Paulina Rubio]]https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/latin/8465893/paulina-rubio-signs-united-talent-agency *[[Radhika Apte]] *[[Ross Lynch]] *[[Sally Field]] *[[Seth Rogen]] *[[Shailene Woodley]] *[[Simon Pegg]] *[[Susan Sarandon]] *[[T.I.]] *[[Tilda Swinton]] *[[Timothée Chalamet]] *[[Toby Keith]] *[[Will Ferrell]] *[[YG (rapper)|YG]] *[[Zach Galifianakis]] {{div col end}} ===Filmmakers and screenwriters=== {{div col|colwidth=20em}} *[[Andrew Adamson]] *[[Wes Anderson]] *[[Judd Apatow]] *[[John August]] *[[Noah Baumbach]] *[[Bryan Bertino]] *[[Brad Bird]] *[[Joel and Ethan Coen]] *[[Alfonso Cuaron]] *[[Asghar Farhadi]] *[[Julian Fellowes]] *[[F. {{ref improve|date=January 2015}} [[Image:Timbre Verigar 15 Slovenie SHS 1918.jpg|right|200px|thumb|15-[[heller (money)|heller]] value]] '''''Verigar''''' was the first [[postage stamp]] series of the [[State of Slovenes, Croats and Serbs]], issued in [[Slovenia]] after the dissolution of the [[Austria-Hungary|Austro-Hungarian monarchy]] at the end of [[World War I]]. The name of the stamp series is derived from the [[Slovene language|Slovene]] word ''veriga'', meaning 'chain', and depicts a [[slave]] who has broken the chains. The scene symbolizes the freedom of the [[Slavic peoples]] from Austria-Hungary. It was designed by the academic painter [[Ivan Vavpotič]], whose model was the gymnast [[Stane Derganc]].
==Description== The stamp design includes the abbreviated name of the State of Slovenes, Croats and Serbs written in [[Serbian Cyrillic]] and [[Gajevica|Gaj’s Latin]] script ("Држава СХС" - "Država SHS"). The stamp design also includes an image that represents a man who has broken the chains enslaving him; he stands in front of a rising sun.
==History== The first stamps of the series were designed in the late 1918 in [[Ljubljana]] during the short-lived [[State of Slovenes, Croats and Serbs]] and issued on 3 January 1919 after the creation of the [[Kingdom of Serbs, Croats and Slovenes]]. They were then published in different versions until 1920. In 1925, Vavpotič regretted the choice of the motif, because he found it kitschy.<ref name="Pošta534">{{cite web |url=http://www.posta.si/opis-postnega-ziga/725/90-let-Verigarjev?nodeid=534 |first=Bojan |last=Bračič |language=Slovenian |title=90 let Verigarjev |trans-title=90 Years of Chainmen |publisher=Pošta Slovenije [Post of Slovenia] |date=March 2009}}</ref> [[File:Slovenija1993verigar.jpg|200px|right|thumb|A 1993 stamp commemorating the 75th Anniversary of the Verigar issue]]
==Commemoration== On 19 March 1993, the [[Post of Slovenia|Slovenian post office]] issued a new stamp series using the ''Verigar'' man to commemorate its 75th anniversary. Another commemorative stamp was published on the 90th anniversary of the series in 2009.<ref name="Pošta534" />
==See also== *[[Postage stamps and postal history of Yugoslavia]]
==References== {{commonscat|Verigar}} {{reflist}}

[[Image:Xochiquetzal.jpg|thumb|Xochiquetzal, from the [[Codex Rios]], 16th century.]] In [[Aztec mythology]], '''Xochiquetzal''' ({{lang-nci-IPA|Xōchiquetzal|ʃoːtʃiˈketsaɬ}}), also called '''Ichpochtli''' {{lang-nci-IPA|Ichpōchtli|itʃˈpoːtʃtɬi||}}, meaning "maiden",<ref name="dic">''Nahuatl Dictionary.'' (1997). Wired Humanities Project. University of Oregon. Retrieved September 1, 2012, from [http://whp.uoregon.edu/dictionaries/nahuatl/index.lasso link]</ref> was a goddess associated with concepts of fertility, beauty, and female sexual power, serving as a protector of young mothers and a patroness of pregnancy, childbirth, and the crafts practised by women such as weaving and embroidery. In pre-Hispanic Maya culture, a similar figure is [[Goddess I]].
==Name== The name ''Xōchiquetzal'' is a compound of ''[[wikt:xochitl|xōchitl]]'' (“flower”) and ''[[wikt:quetzalli|quetzalli]]'' (“precious feather; quetzal tail feather”). In Classical Nahuatl morphology, the first element in a compound modifies the second, and thus the goddess' name can literally be taken to mean “flower precious feather”, or ”flower quetzal feather”. Her alternative name, ''Ichpōchtli'', corresponds to a personalized usage of ''[[wikt:ichpochtli|ichpōchtli]]'' (“maiden, young woman”).
==Description== [[Image:Ichpuchtli.jpg|thumb|left|Xochiquetzal in [[Codex Borgia]].]]
Unlike several other figures in the complex of Aztec female earth deities connected with agricultural and sexual fecundity, Xochiquetzal is always depicted as an alluring and youthful woman, richly attired and symbolically associated with vegetation and in particular flowers. By connotation, Xochiquetzal is also representative of human desire, pleasure, and excess, appearing also as patroness of artisans involved in the manufacture of luxury items.<ref>Clendinnen (1991, p.163); Miller & Taube (1993, p.190); Smith (2003, p.203)</ref>
She was followed by a retinue consisting of [[birds]] and [[butterfly|butterflies]]. Worshippers wore animal and flower masks at a festival, held in her honor every eight years. Her twin was [[Xochipilli]] and her husband was [[Tlaloc]], until [[Tezcatlipoca]] kidnapped her and she was forced to marry him. At one point, she was also married to [[Centeotl]] and [[Xiuhtecuhtli]]. By [[Mixcoatl]], she was the mother of [[Quetzalcoatl]].
Ichpōchtli is an alternative form of Xochiquetzal representative of beauty, sex, crafts, fertility, dance, music, singing, weaving, magic, and love spells. [[Tagetes|Marigolds]] are sacred to her.
Anthropologist Hugo Nutini identifies her with the [[Virgin of Ocotlan]] in his article on patron saints in [[Tlaxcala]].<ref>Nutini (1976), ''passim.''</ref>
